text: Hey, can someone who has the HubSpot VS Code extension installed please go to settings in VSCode > key bindings > and look up "toggle comment"? My comments don't work and I'm pretty much trying everything at this point.
my bindings look like this at the moment
I've tried a bunch of combinations
<@UDHT6N5SM> did you get your comments working when using the plugin? Mine aren't working either.
No, I'm pretty sure it's a legit bug
I was banging my head also.
I opened this issue on Github: <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-vscode/issues/110>
might help if you leave a comment or do whatever you can

there's this log thing I found in another post:
```Run the command Developer: Toggle Keyboard Shortcuts Troubleshooting
This will activate logging of dispatched keyboard shortcuts and will open an output panel with the corresponding log file.
Press exactly the keybinding you desire.
check what VS Code detects and what command is invoked.```
it does look like it's recognizing the right keys and "triggering" the toggle
but something probably happens on the HubSpot extension side

Anyone know if this looks right:
```[2021-06-18 16:43:00.269] [renderer1] [info] [KeybindingService]: / Received  keydown event - modifiers: [meta], code: MetaLeft, keyCode: 91, key: Meta
[2021-06-18 16:43:00.269] [renderer1] [info] [KeybindingService]: | Converted keydown event - modifiers: [meta], code: MetaLeft, keyCode: 57 ('Meta')
[2021-06-18 16:43:00.269] [renderer1] [info] [KeybindingService]: \ Keyboard event cannot be dispatched in keydown phase.
[2021-06-18 16:43:00.412] [renderer1] [info] [KeybindingService]: / Received  keydown event - modifiers: [meta], code: Slash, keyCode: 191, key: /
[2021-06-18 16:43:00.412] [renderer1] [info] [KeybindingService]: | Converted keydown event - modifiers: [meta], code: Slash, keyCode: 85 ('/')
[2021-06-18 16:43:00.413] [renderer1] [info] [KeybindingService]: | Resolving meta+[Slash]
[2021-06-18 16:43:00.413] [renderer1] [info] [KeybindingService]: \ From 1 keybinding entries, matched editor.action.commentLine, when: editorTextFocus && !editorReadonly, source: built-in.
[2021-06-18 16:43:00.612] [renderer1] [info] [KeybindingService]: + Storing single modifier for possible chord meta.
[2021-06-18 16:43:00.913] [renderer1] [info] [KeybindingService]: + Clearing single modifier due to 300ms elapsed.```
that's from hitting `command + /`
This is all I got but I have all my extension disabled except HubSpot.
